repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: I did my best to fully sync `libcpp.string` with the standard and cover all overloads with meaningful tests. The only missing bits are the search functions. The highlight of this version is the introduction of iterators and corresponding overloads (note some of the hack comments I left). If anything, this is an excellent stress test for Cython overload resolution engine :-)

comment_data.body: What does the `#6` refer to here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,6 +181,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string& append(const char* s) except +
         string& append(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string& append(size_t n, char c) except +
+        string_ref append[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

comment_data.body: I assume the return type is necessary to get this to work in Cython? It obviously isn't part of the C++ signature, but I'm fine with it if it's needed here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,7 +128,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string(const char* s) except +
         string(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string(size_t n, char c) except +
-        string(iterator first, iterator last) except +
+        string_ref string[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

comment_data.body: `test_indexing` seems to have gone missing. I assume unintentionally
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,234 +55,333 @@ def test_conversion(py_obj):
     cdef string s = py_obj
     return s
 
-def test_indexing(char *py_str):

comment_data.body: This refers to the number of the overload in the C++ standard. You will notice that in my rewrite (which I have abandoned for the purposes of the rebase until a consensus is reached, as explained in the comment), I have consistently numbered all overloads according to the standard to ensure that they are implemented correctly and none are missing.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,6 +181,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string& append(const char* s) except +
         string& append(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string& append(size_t n, char c) except +
+        string_ref append[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

comment_data.body:
It has been renamed to `test_access`. Sorry, the diff looks stupid. Here is the code for reference:

```python
def test_indexing(char *py_str):
    """
    >>> test_indexing(b_asdf)
    ('s', 's')
    """
    cdef string s
    s = string(py_str)
    return chr(s[1]), chr(s.at(1))
```

```python
def test_access(string s, i):
    """
    >>> test_access(b_asdf, 1) == (ord(b_asdf[1:2]), ) * 2
    True
    >>> test_access(b_asdf, 5)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
    Traceback (most recent call last):
        ...
    IndexError: ...
    """
    return s.at(i), s[I]
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -54,234 +55,333 @@ def test_conversion(py_obj):
     cdef string s = py_obj
     return s
 
-def test_indexing(char *py_str):

comment_data.body: Oh yes, unfortunately templated constructors don't work without type. I've replaced it with `void` if that's any better. Or is `string&` actually clearer? Should I add some kind of comment?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,7 +128,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string(const char* s) except +
         string(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string(size_t n, char c) except +
-        string(iterator first, iterator last) except +
+        string_ref string[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

@@ -54,234 +55,333 @@ def test_conversion(py_obj):
     cdef string s = py_obj
     return s
 
-def test_indexing(char *py_str):

comment_data.body: There was a comment `        # return type is a hack to allow the code to compile` in one of the diffs along the way. I think it's a useful comment. `string_ref` is probably clearer, but it doesn't matter too much.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,7 +128,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string(const char* s) except +
         string(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string(size_t n, char c) except +
-        string(iterator first, iterator last) except +
+        string_ref string[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

comment_data.body: TODO: add comment or remove templating. See #489.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,7 +128,7 @@ cdef extern from "<string>" namespace "std" nogil:
         string(const char* s) except +
         string(const char* s, size_t n) except +
         string(size_t n, char c) except +
-        string(iterator first, iterator last) except +
+        string_ref string[input_iterator](input_iterator, input_iterator) except +  # (6)

commit.message: ENH: Add libcpp.string declarations & cover them with tests

title: ENH: Rewrite & cover with tests libcpp.string declarations
